translated: As It Was Said
The Tens
The First Section
Deceitful Birth

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, said by the Arahant, so I have heard:

original: “Nayidaṁ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṁ vussati janakuhanatthaṁ, na janalapanatthaṁ, na lābhasakkārasilokānisaṁsatthaṁ, na ‘iti maṁ jano jānātū’ti.
analyzed: na yida bhikkhave brahmacariyam vussati jana kuhanattha na jana lapanattha na lābha sakkāra silokānisasattha na iti mama janaḥ jānātu uti
translated: “Monks, this spiritual life is not lived for the sake of deceiving people, for the sake of arguing with people, for the sake of winning debates, for the sake of getting material possessions, for the sake of fame, or for the sake of ‘May people know me as one with such great wisdom and great vision.’

original: Atha kho idaṁ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṁ vussati saṁvaratthañceva pahānatthañcā”ti.
analyzed: atha kho idam bhikkhave brahmacariyam vussati savara attham ca iva pahāna attham ca ati
translated: But this spiritual life is lived for the sake of restraint and the sake of abandoning.”
The Blessed One said this.
And in this connection it was said:
“For the sake of restraint and abandoning,
the spiritual life is not lived in vain.
The Blessed One taught it
to lead to the crossing of the abyss.
This is the path followed
by the great ones, the seers.
Those who practice it
as taught by the Buddha
will make an end to suffering,
those who follow the Teacher’s instruction.”

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: This is the meaning of what the Blessed One said. So it was heard by me.
The eighth.
